meanings.sent1: The cheetah will zingare across the savanna to catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: I zingare through the obstacle course to beat the record time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel zingares up the tree to escape the curious dog.
meanings.sent4: Her words zingare through the room, leaving everyone stunned.
meanings.sent5: The ballerina's feet zingare across the stage with grace and precision.

meanings.sent1: The zingare of the whistle signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud zingare coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The zingare of the fire alarm startled the sleeping cat.

meanings.sent5: The zingare of the car horn made everyone turn their heads.

meanings.definition: A quality of excitement or liveliness
meanings.sent1: The party was full of zingare, with music and laughter filling the air.
meanings.sent2: Her performance on stage had a zingare that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The zingare of the children playing in the park brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The zingare of the city nightlife was infectious, drawing people out of their homes.
meanings.sent5: The zingare of the festival could be felt in the colorful decorations and lively music.
